meanings.definition: One who forsakes or abandons something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The forsaker left his friends behind.
meanings.sent2: The forsaker was known for abandoning his responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The forsaker forgot his lunch at home again!
meanings.sent4: The forsaker's actions spoke louder than words.
meanings.sent5: The forsaker's departure left a void in the group.

meanings.definition: To renounce or give up on something or someone.
meanings.sent1: She decided to forsaker her unhealthy habits.
meanings.sent2: He will forsaker his old ways and start anew.
meanings.sent3: I will forsaker my fear of heights and climb that mountain!
meanings.sent4: The artist chose to forsaker traditional techniques for a more modern approach.
meanings.sent5: The decision to forsaker his dreams haunted him for years.

meanings.definition: To leave or desert something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The soldier had to forsaker his post to save his comrades.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't bear to forsaker her loyal dog.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to forsaker its favorite toy, only to pounce on it later.
meanings.sent4: The ship seemed to forsaker the safety of the harbor for the adventure of the open sea.
meanings.sent5: The traveler had to forsaker his guide and find his own way through the forest.
